definition: to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
pretense that turns into reality (idiom); to play at make-believe, but accidentally make it true

sentences.english: Thank hypocrisy, thanks to get away with parading falsehoods suddenly sincere lies.
sentences.chinese: 感謝虛僞突然誠懇，感謝謊言弄假成真。

sentences.english: This is everyone's childhood dream in a game.
sentences.chinese: 這個遊戲讓我們童年的美夢成真了。

sentences.english: Fuel pump is humming call blocking as a vacuum pump was caused by smoking.
sentences.chinese: 汽油泵嗡嗡叫聲是因阻塞油泵被抽成真空所引起。

sentences.english: If you could have every single desire granted to you right now, would you be happy then?
sentences.chinese: 如果現在你的願望都成真，你會幸福嗎？

sentences.english: So clear and deep are my fancies, of things I wish were true.
sentences.chinese: 那如此清淅且深刻的迷戀，真希望能夠美夢成真。

sentences.english: What if wishes all came true?
sentences.chinese: 要是所有的願望都成真呢？

sentences.english: It was the sweetest thing that ever could be, it was a fantasy, a dream come true.
sentences.chinese: 那是最甜蜜的事，讓我如臨仙境，夢想成真。

sentences.english: Product supply is the place translates innovation to reality.
sentences.chinese: 寶潔公司產品供應部就是見證創新，夢想成真的地方。

sentences.english: Dream, Dream, follow your dream, without dream, how wishes come true?
sentences.chinese: 把害怕高高束起，相信自己，你會夢想成真。

sentences.english: For some it would be like a dream come true.
sentences.chinese: 對某些人來說，這就猶如夢想成真般美妙。

sentences.english: When my dream comes true, all men will be truly equal, happy.
sentences.chinese: 當我的夢想成真，所有的人將會真正的平等，幸福。

sentences.english: Tak your passion and mak it com tru.
sentences.chinese: 開釋你的熱情，讓美夢成真。

sentences.english: New year is coming, I wish everyone will be happy.
sentences.chinese: 轉眼間又是一年，但願每個人夢想成真。

sentences.english: Those who achieve their dreams are clear on what their intentions are.
sentences.chinese: 夢想成真的人都有明確的目標。

sentences.english: Thank you for false suddenly sincere thanks to lie, bowfinger.
sentences.chinese: 感謝虛僞突然誠懇，感謝謊言弄假成真。

sentences.english: He says that a move to the Stade Olimpico would be a dream come true.
sentences.chinese: 他說回到奧林匹克那一天就是他夢想成真的那一天。

definition: dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream
to be shattered/to be annihilated (of hope, illusions etc)
to achieve Buddhahood through one's efforts and insight/to obtain a positive outcome after sustained efforts/to come to fruition
(idiom) to have one's words turn out to be (tragically) prophetic
right under one's nose/right in front of one's eyes/close at hand/imminent
see 黃粱夢|黄粱梦[huang2 liang2 meng4]
lit. wind from an empty cave (idiom)/fig. unfounded (story)/baseless (claim)
